title: Rise and Fall winner: Arjun Bijlani lifts the trophy of the reality show

title: India cut Russian oil imports by 50%? After Trump, White House makes big claim
description: Indian refiners are reportedly set to halve their Russian oil imports, a White House official stated. However, Indian sources suggest this reduction hasn't materialized yet, with December/January data expected to show any change. Meanwhile, the Ministry of External Affairs denied any recent conversation between PM Modi and US President Trump regarding this matter, emphasizing India's consumer-centric energy policy.

title: ‘You are a pig Trump’: Hackers breach several airports in US, Canada
description: Public address systems and display screens at four North American airports were compromised, broadcasting pro-Hamas messages and anti-Trump sentiments. The cyberattacks targeted Harrisburg International Airport in Pennsylvania, and Windsor, Kelowna, and Victoria International Airports in Canada. While authorities deemed the overall disruption minimal, investigations are underway to address the security breach and its potential implications.

title: Who is Shannon Kobylarczyk? Milwaukee Brewers fan controversy explained

Her employer, ManPowerGroup, terminated her employment, and she resigned from the Make-A-Wish Foundation board. The incident highlights the rapid online response to displays of hate.

description: Aaron Rodgers, now with the Steelers, keeps his wife Brittani a complete mystery. Despite his public return to football, no photos or public appearances of her exist, and even teammates haven't met her. Rodgers emphasizes her desire for privacy, stating she didn't sign up for celebrity life. He credits her with profoundly changing his world and being his unwavering support.

title: 'Insufficient evidence': US appeals court blocks Trump's request to send National Guard to Chicago
description: A US appeals court has blocked President Trump's order to deploy the National Guard in Chicago, citing a lack of evidence for rebellion or danger. The court found that protests against immigration policies, even if spirited, do not justify such a deployment. This ruling follows similar challenges from Illinois, Oregon, and California against the administration's use of federal troops domestically.

description: South Korea's Supreme Court has sent back a massive $1 billion divorce settlement for SK Group Chairman Chey Tae-won's estranged wife, Roh Soh-yeong, for review. The court deemed funds from Roh's father, a former president, as bribe money, thus ineligible for the settlement. This decision offers Chey immediate financial relief while the case awaits further deliberation.

The 28-year-old dermatologist's husband, a gastroenterologist, is under investigation after a post-mortem revealed anaesthesia in her system. He remains tight-lipped about the events leading to her demise.

description: Gabrielle Union celebrated her father's 81st birthday with a heartfelt Instagram message, expressing gratitude for their connection despite his ongoing battle with dementia. She shared touching moments, including his joy at seeing her and Dwyane Wade. Their daughter Kaavia also posted a touching tribute to her grandpa with an emotional post reflecting back to the time when she held his arms for first time.

title: Happy Diwali 2025: Top 60 wishes, messages to light up the celebrations
description: Diwali, the festival of lights, is celebrated with great fervor, symbolizing hope, knowledge, and love. Families gather to share happiness, exchange gifts, and create lasting memories. The article provides 50 wishes, messages, and quotes to help express gratitude and spread joy during this auspicious occasion.

title: Salesforce CEO asks Anthropic CEO: Why are you still hiring engineers; Amodei replies
description: AI now crafts 90% of code for Anthropic teams, yet CEO Dario Amodei insists on retaining engineers. These professionals now focus on complex 10% tasks and supervising AI, boosting productivity tenfold. This trend, seen across startups, challenges entry-level developers while experienced ones remain secure, reshaping the tech landscape.

title: MacKenzie Scott cuts Amazon stake by 42%; now holds $12.6bn; prioritises equity work
description: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, cutting holdings by nearly 42% to $12.6 billion. This reduction occurred despite Amazon's stock performance and follows her extensive philanthropic efforts, which have heavily focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. The exact reasons for the stake reduction, whether sales or donations, remain unspecified.

title: All Mega Evolutions ranked in Pokemon Legends: Z-A — full tier list
description: Pokemon Legends: Z-A has unveiled exciting new Mega Evolutions, transforming beloved creatures like Zygarde and Greninja into formidable forces. This tier list ranks these powerful forms based on battle prowess, accessibility, and strategic typing, offering players a guide to the game's most impactful transformations. Discover which Megas dominate the battlefield.
